articles.title: Photo exhibition on GIs' murder of schoolgirls opens
KCNA assails U.S. secret military exercise
Mexico-Korea Friendship Association formed
articles.content:
Mexico-Korea Friendship Association formed 
    Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Mexico-Korea Friendship Association was inaugurated with due ceremony on January 15.
 The chairman of the association said at the ceremony that the association would organize various political and cultural functions to mark the birthday of Kim Jong Il (February 16) and express full support to the Korean people in their struggle to build a powerful nation and achieve reunification of the country under the army-based policy.    
 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the ceremony.

Bush's nuclear racket slammed abroad
articles.content:
Bush's nuclear racket slammed abroad
    Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Foreign news media, political parties, organizations and public figures castigated the bush administration for its nuclear racket aimed to isolate the DPRK.
 In recent three months alone, more than 400 news media including the Russian newspaper Pravda, LAO News Agency, Radio Guinea and the U.S. newspaper workers' world brought to light the nature of the nuclear issue in the Korean Peninsula and criticized the U.S. for causing the nuclear crisis.    
 Over 270 political parties, organizations and public figures of at least 70 countries, including the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the General Secretary of the Socialist Revolutionary Party of Peru and the Secretary General of the Arabic Association for Arts, Culture and Information of Egypt, made public statements, letters of protest and bulletins condemning the U.S. for nullifying the DPRK-U.S. Agreed Framework and the Bush administration for compelling the DPRK to withdraw from the NPT.

articles.title: Bush hit for slandering DPRK
